frameDefinitions: A Speaker conventionally uses a particular Term to refer to an Entity.
A New filler occupies a Role or serves a Function after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
The Agent is assigned to a Post where he or she performs a task associated with that Post.
An Agent behaves as if they were a particular individual or type of Simulated_entity with the intent of misleading observers of their behavior.
An Agent occupies a Role in some institution.
The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path.
frameExamples: The pattern of conservation is similar to that found in C1_1, therefore we have <t>termed</t> this domain DC1 for divergent C1 domain.
The belfast bank robbers <t>posed</t> as police.
Chris <t>served</t> as chairman of the boardfor one year.
She <t>walked</t> along the road for a while.
listRoleDefinitions: The type of <fen>Entity</fen> that is conventionally referred to by a <fen>Term</fen>.
The linguistic sign that is used for referring to a type of <fen>Entity</fen>.
The speaker or speech community that uses a <fen>Term</fen> to refer to a particular <fen>Entity</fen>.
The new filler of the <fen>Role</fen> that was previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen> filler.
The category that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities fit into as a result of the <fen>Function</fen> they serve.
The (generally desirable) state of affairs that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities are involved in bringing about.
The entity that occupied the <fen>Role</fen> or served the <fen>Function</fen> before the <fen>New</fen> filler.
The time at which the <fen>New</fen> takes up the <fen>Role</fen> previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is assigned to a <fen>Post</fen> to perform a task involving a <fen>Salient_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Post</fen> is a location or station assigned to the <fen>Agent</fen> where a task or tasks are to be performed.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is centrally involved in the task the <fen>Agent</fen> is assigned to perform. It is normally located at the <fen>Post</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> works at the <fen>Post</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> staffs the <fen>Post</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who acts in a misleading way to create the impression that they are a particular individual or type of <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>.
The type or individual that the <fen>Agent</fen> gives the impression of being.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> impersonates the <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> gives the impression that they are the <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the entity that occpuies the <fen>Role</fen>.
The <fen>Role</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> occupies.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> served in the <fen>Role</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> served in the <fen>Role</fen>.
<fen>Self_mover</fen> is the living being which moves under its own power. Normally it is expressed as an external argument.

<fen>Source</fen> is used for any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion.
In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion.  With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
<fen>Path</fen> is used for any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>.  This includes 'middle of path'' expressions.
<fen>Goal</fen> is used for any expression which tells where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion.

<fen>Area</fen> is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path.  Note that this role should not be used for cases when the same phrase could be used with the same meaning with a non-motion target, since these should be annotated with the <fen>Place</fen> FE.
The direction that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> heads in during the motion.
The time when the motion occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which a defined motion takes place.  Any specified or implied  <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> should designate a location contained with the <fen>Place</fen>.  This role can be differentiated from <fen>Area</fen> by the fact that the annotated phrase can be used in the same meaning with non-motion targets.
listRoleExamples: Because of that shift, physicists call <fex>this effect</fex> the 'gravitational red shift.'
The French term this plant <fex>Petit Chêne</fex>, from the shape of the leaves.
<fex>Mathematicians</fex> call this subject 'arithmetic,' reserving the word 'algebra' for the more advanced aspects of the subject.
The traditional thatched roof has often been replaced <fex>by corrugated galvanized iron</fex>.
What gas replaced Hydrogen <fex>as a safer medium for use in balloons</fex> on account it does not burn?
Oil and gas replaced coal <fex>in heating homes, in industry, and in transportation</fex>.
The electron was discovered and <fex>electricity</fex> replaced gas lamps.
When electricity replaced oil <fex>in the early 1930's</fex>, the steady beam was replaced by a flashing light.
Sue was staffing <fex>the entrance</fex> when everything started to go wrong.
Working the front desk <fex>at a real estate office</fex> is not as fulfilling as it might seem.
The cat ran <fex>out of the house</fex>.
You should walk <fex>south</fex> about a block .
The hitchhikers walked <fex>in the middle of the road</fex>.
